body.name: IRONCK Bookcases and Bookshelves Triple Wide 6 Tiers Industrial Record Player Shelf, Large Etagere Bookshelf Open Record Player Shelves with Metal Frame for Living Room Home Office
features: Dimensions: 11.8 inches in depth, 72.8 inches in width, and 79.5 inches in height. Each shelf can hold up to 33 lbs.
17 open shelves provide ample storage space and keep your daily essentials organized, while maximizing vertical storage.
The angled midsection of the bookshelf makes it easy to grab a book quickly.
Constructed from solid MDF boards and stylish matte black iron brackets, this industrial-style display rack complements other furniture in your living room, bedroom, study, or office.
The Tipover Resistance Device ensures that the bookshelf remains stable and does not wobble or topple.
With 8 large iron frames and clear part numbers and installation steps, assembly is made much easier.
The adjustable bottom small feet and X-shaped brackets ensure the stability and balance of the bookshelf.
If you encounter any issues with our products, please do not hesitate to contact us.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Maximize the vertical storage space while keep your daily essentials in organize

Angled Midsection By tilting the middle section of the bookcase, we have made it easier for you to grab a book quickly and without any hassle. You no longer have to spend time searching through a stack of books or reaching deep into a shelf to find the book you want. 3.94-inch Side Panel These side panels act as a protective barrier, preventing your belongings from accidentally falling off the sides of the shelves. Adjustable Bottom Small Feet They allow you to adjust the height of the feet to accommodate any unevenness in the floor, ensuring that the bookcase remains level and does not wobble or tip over.
Material: MDF board and metal Color Vintage Brown Size: 72.8"W x11.8"D x79.5"H Weight Capacity 33 lbs/shelf

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very sturdy, but takes time and 2 people to put together
reviews.reviewText: The instructions are a bit confusing and you really need 2 people. But if you pay very close attention to the specific holes and sides of where things should be, it goes along relatively smoothly. Once together, it looks nice and is very sturdy. Was worth the work.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very nice bookshelf. And a good price.
reviews.reviewText: It was easy to assemble once I got it through my thick skull that the holes in the support columns back side all need to be facing the same direction so the support cross beams can have a place to go. The instructions don't really clarify that , but now that I have put it together, taken it apart, put it together , taken it apart, then finally realized I was making this way harder than I needed to, put it together the final time. Bottom line of you can deduce common sense, it is super easy to put together. Look at me. I put it together 3 times! Go me! It is a really sturdy , strong piece. And hey! It even survived me assembling and disassembling this dang thing OH so many times. I really like the look as well. And BONUS,.it matches my antique buffet that my husband commandeered as a stand for his insanely and ungodly huge TV. Bottom line, this shelving unit is strong, resilient and beautiful. Like the me I aspire to be. :)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars LOVE, LOVE, LOOOOVE.
reviews.reviewText: Fabulous shelf, and it went together so quickly and easily! Under half an hour, doing it on my own. Recommend 2 people, for sure, as it would be much easier, and even quicker! It looks so beautiful in my living room, and has more space than I even thought it was. Super sturdy, too!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Purchased this for my teenager's bedroom. Very sturdy and easy to assemble. Does take an extra set of hands, but nonetheless it was fairly simple. Great quality!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 28, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Outside of the tons of screws, this was easy to assemble, looks great and super nice for the price. Holds all my books, scrapbooks and some nic nacs.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This is a great bookshelf!
reviews.reviewText: Assembly was really NOT that bad at all. A little bit tedious and while it's illustrated fairly well, it's similar to how ikea instructions try to do more with pics than words. Took me about an hour to get it up and ready to store a few tons of books. It looks really good and once all the shelves are tied together with the back bracing, it's incredibly sturdy. For the price it can't be beat. If I built one out of oak, it would technically be better and nicer, but also cost me more in raw material than this thing cost to be dropped off at the door ready to assemble. ---it is VERY heavy to try and move the shipping box by yourself, just FYI.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great value for the price
reviews.reviewText: We bought this for our store and it is great. The size was just right and you can even chain more together. It also looks great, customers often ask where we got it, it is just a great piece overall.Really the quality is through the roof too. It has been a long time since I put together furniture that was as easy as this. If this brand stays strong and does not start cost cutting measures like other brands have done many times in the past we will stick with IRONCK for all simple furniture needs.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This is such an amazing DIY shelf unit. Absolutely beautiful. It can easily be put together by one person. If you don't have spare room It can be a bit of a pain though. Most importantly, make sure the holes on the metal frame are all on one side for the crossing braces so you don't have to redo your work. Also make sure your sides are lined up correctly in the metal frame so you don't have to move 4 of the 5 shelves like I did to be able to add in the center floating shelves, lol.
